title: Week Review & Self-Test
goal: Consolidate everything from Week 1 and assess your readiness for Week 2.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Say the 12 gismu aloud from memory. No peeking.

1. ______  (love)
2. ______  (go)
3. ______  (talk)
4. ______  (eat)
5. ______  (drink)
6. ______  (walk)
7. ______  (write)
8. ______  (read)
9. ______  (sleep)
10. ______ (beautiful)
11. ______ (good)
12. ______ (bad)
Answers
  1. prami
  2. klama
  3. tavla
  4. citka
  5. pinxe
  6. cadzu
  7. ciska
  8. tcidu
  9. sipna
  10. melbi
  11. xamgu
  12. xlali

How many did you get? If fewer than 10, review Day 6 before continuing.

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

What You Learned This Week

1. Sounds

  • 6 vowels: a e i o u y (y = schwa, rare)
  • 4 diphthongs: ai, ei, oi, au
  • Special consonants: c = "sh", j = "zh", x = "kh", . = pause
  • Stress: always penultimate syllable

2. Word Types

Type Description Examples
gismu root word, 5 letters prami, klama, tavla
cmavo grammar word, short mi, do, cu, .i
cmevla name, ends in consonant .alis., .tam.

3. Sentence Structure (Bridi)

[x1 sumti] cu [selbri] [x2 sumti] [x3 sumti] ...
  • sumti = participants (nouns)
  • selbri = relationship (verb-like)
  • bridi = complete claim

Example: mi cu tavla do — I talk to you.

4. Place Structures

Each gismu has fixed slots with specific meanings:

Gismu x1 x2 x3+
prami lover beloved —
tavla talker listener topic, language
citka eater food —
klama goer destination origin, route, vehicle

5. Key Cmavo

Cmavo Function
mi I, me
do you
ti this (near speaker)
ta that (near listener)
cu marks selbri start
.i sentence separator

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (12 points)

Translate to English:

  1. sipna →
  2. melbi →
  3. xlali →
  4. ciska →
  5. tcidu →
  6. cadzu →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. love →
  2. go →
  3. talk →
  4. eat →
  5. drink →
  6. good →
Answers
  1. sleep
  2. beautiful
  3. bad
  4. write
  5. read
  6. walk
  7. prami
  8. klama
  9. tavla
  10. citka
  11. pinxe
  12. xamgu

Part B: Sentence Translation (6 points)

Translate to English:

  1. mi cu prami do
  2. ti xlali .i ta xamgu
  3. do sipna .i mi cadzu
Answers
  1. I love you.
  2. This is bad. That is good.
  3. You sleep. I walk.

Translate to Lojban:

  1. I eat this.
  2. You are beautiful.
  3. I write. You read.
Answers
  1. mi citka ti
  2. do melbi (or do cu melbi)
  3. mi ciska .i do tcidu

Part C: Place Structure (4 points)

Fill in the x2 meaning:

  1. prami — x2 is the ______
  2. tavla — x2 is the ______
  3. cadzu — x2 is the ______
  4. citka — x2 is the ______
Answers
  1. beloved (the one who is loved)
  2. listener (the one talked to)
  3. walking surface
  4. food

Part D: Error Correction (3 points)

Find and fix the error in each sentence:

  1. ✗ mi .i do tavla (I. You talk.)
  2. ✗ mi cadzu do (intended: I walk to you)
  3. ✗ prami mi do (intended: I love you)
Answers
  1. ✓ mi tavla .i do tavla — The .i was misplaced; there was no selbri in the first bridi.
  2. ✓ mi klama do — cadzu x2 is the surface, not destination. Use klama for "go to."
  3. ✓ mi prami do — x1 must come before the selbri, not after.

Scoring

Section Points Your Score
Part A 12 ___
Part B 6 ___
Part C 4 ___
Part D 3 ___
Total 25 ___

Interpretation:

  • 23-25: Excellent. Ready for Week 2.
  • 18-22: Good. Review weak areas, then proceed.
  • 13-17: Fair. Revisit Days 3-5 before moving on.
  • Below 13: Repeat Week 1. No shame — mastery takes repetition.

Free Production Challenge (1-2 min)

Create 5 original sentences using this week's vocabulary. Try to:

  • Use at least 5 different gismu
  • Include at least one .i chain
  • Include at least one sentence with ti or ta

Example set:

mi citka .i do pinxe
ti melbi
mi prami do
ta xlali
do cadzu .i mi sipna

Say your sentences aloud. Check that each one makes sense.

sections.content:
Summary

You completed Week 1 of Lojban. You can now pronounce all Lojban sounds, build simple bridi with sumti and selbri, use 12 gismu and 6 cmavo, chain sentences with .i, and understand that each gismu has a fixed place structure.

Next week preview: Week 2 introduces names (cmevla), the vocative coi (hello), and more pronouns. You'll learn to greet people and talk about specific individuals.

Congratulations

.i do xamgu .i do melbi .i mi prami do

(You are good. You are beautiful. I love you.)

You've taken your first real steps into Lojban. Keep going.
